project.teaser: AD-ASTRA (Aerospace Districts: Acceleration of the Strategic Transfer of Regional Advancements) is a project about the positive interconnection among innovation ecosystems, with a focus on aerospace sectors.The proposal aims at the development of a connected, competitive...
project.objective: AD-ASTRA (Aerospace Districts: Acceleration of the Strategic Transfer of Regional Advancements) is a project about the positive interconnection among innovation ecosystems, with a focus on aerospace sectors. The proposal aims at the development of a connected, competitive, interregional innovation ecosystem between 5 EU regions (Toulouse, South Holland, Madrid, Apulia, Emilia-Romagna) with: a shared interest in fostering aerospace sectors, enhancing the cross-contamination to and from other innovative sectors (e.g., automotive, biomedical, agri-food, big data); different innovation readiness levels; aerospace districts with different levels of maturity and consolidation. “Diversity generates wealth”: the collaboration of these markedly diverse regions, furthermore represented by partners from different spheres of the quadruple-helix, will be a growth opportunity. The establishment of a solid and long-lasting collaborative EU network, able to exploit complementary skills, experiences, territorial and industrial vocations, will contribute to create a “critical mass” in EU strategic sectors such as innovation and aerospace, where global competition leads to a confrontation with actors of increasing size and requires innovative models and approaches. This ambitious goal will be achieved through an iterative process: starting from the collection, analysis and systematization of the experiences (competencies, technologies, networks) of the partner regions with reference to their aerospace districts; analyzing the future evolutions of the ecosystems, in response to technological, economic, political, and social megatrends; correcting or validating hypotheses and evolution models with the support of stakeholder groups; defining an action plan for the development of each of the regional aerospace ecosystems, valuing experiences and good practices stemming from other regions and strengthening spin-in and spin-out processes to and from other industrial sector and territories.
project.title: Aerospace Districts: Acceleration of the Strategic Transfer of Regional Advancements
project.keywords: Aerospace, Space Economy, Ecosystems Interconnections, Industrial Sector Revamping

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - AD-ASTRA (Aerospace Districts: Acceleration of the Strategic Transfer of Regional Advancements)
result.teaser: AD-ASTRA (Aerospace Districts: Acceleration of the Strategic Transfer of Regional Advancements) is a project about the positive interconnection among innovation ecosystems, with a focus on aerospace sectors. The project aims at the development of a connected, competitive...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Initial report on the SWOT analysis, relevant networks, and innovation barriers mitigation
result.description: This report will collect the intermediate information collected by the initial SWOT analysis performing in the different ecosystems Each SWOT will be done by local partner following a framework done by TM This common framework will allow to have a global view of the different ecosystems allowing future connections or collaborations

result.title: Communication kit
result.description: The communication kit is a set of templates docx pptx based on the visual identity of the project and that will be created for dissemination materials

result.title: Action Plan
result.description: The action plan will outline present and foreseen future connections among the ecosystems, identifying key technologies transferrable to and from the aerospace sector, actual regional gaps, and corrective activities to overcome these gaps and the operative modes to avoid competition barriers to the transfer of knowledge and technologies. The action plan will also evaluate the replicability of good practices from one region to others, and the eventual corrective actions to be held in order to overcome possible specific criticalities of territories.

result.title: Final data management plan (DMP)
result.description: The Data Management Plan will contain the data management structure and the rules that will apply during the project life cycle, and after the project end. The Final version of this plan will gather all the information collected during the project and will be valid after the project end (for a specific period).

result.title: Initial data management plan (DMP)
result.description: The Data Management Plan will contain the data management structure and the rules that will apply during the project life cycle and after the project end for a specific periodThe initial version of this plan will be mainly applied during the project life cycle

result.title: Project website
result.description: This the public website of the project

result.title: Megatrends and future developments analysis
result.description: Overview of megatrends with possible effect on the various aerospace regions with regional examples of copingpreparing for a changing world and interregional realistic or futuristic scenarios to work together successfully in dealing with and possibly anticipating a megatrend and how to benefit from it

result.title: Innovation inventory
result.description: Report describing the stakeholders relevant innovation and technical capabilities in each region involved in the project and any international connection

result.title: Former successful connections and case studies
result.description: Cartography of the existing and past connections underlining the success cases between members of different ecosystems and the ecosystems themselves

result.title: Report on the interregional workshops and exchange activities
result.description: This deliverable will report the outcomes of the interregional co-creation workshops, in particular focusing on exchange and dissemination of existing knowledge in the field of aerospace and provide essential inputs for innovation (including challenges faced by the aerospace sector, way of collaboration among regions, knowledge transfer, concrete suggestions and inputs from the local audience to start triggering new business or research ideas).

result.title: Final report on the SWOT analysis, relevant networks, and innovation barriers mitigation
result.description: This report will collect all the information collected by the complete SWOT analysis performed in the different ecosystems. Each SWOT will be done by local partner following a framework done by TM. This common framework will allow to have a global view of the different ecosystems, allowing future connections or collaborations.

result.title: Report on the foreseen impacts and potential beneficiaries
result.description: This deliverable will report information on the identification of the impacts of the foreseen actions, and the beneficiaries potentially involved. In particular, the impacts will not cover exclusively the aerospace districts of each region, but also other industrial ecosystems.

category.title: big data
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/data science/big data

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
